EDAspy.optimization.univariate package¶

Submodules¶

EDAspy.optimization.univariate.continuous module¶

class EDAspy.optimization.univariate.continuous.UMDAc(SIZE_GEN, MAX_ITER, DEAD_ITER, ALPHA, vector, aim, cost_function)¶

Bases: object

Univariate marginal Estimation of Distribution algorithm continuous. New individuals are sampled from a vector of univariate normal distributions.

Parameters

  • SIZE_GEN (int) – total size of the generations in the execution of the algorithm

  • MAX_ITER (int) – total number of iterations in case that optimum is not yet found. If reached, the optimum found is returned

  • DEAD_ITER (int) – total number of iteration with no better solution found. If reached, the optimum found is returned

  • ALPHA (float [0-1]) – percentage of the generation tu take, in order to sample from them. The best individuals selection

  • vector (pandas dataframe with columns ['mu', 'std'] and optional ['min', 'max']) – vector of normal distributions to sample from

  • aim ('minimize' or 'maximize'.) – Represents the optimization aim.

  • cost_function (callable function which receives a dictionary as input and returns a numeric) – a callable function implemented by the user, to optimize.

Raises

Exception – cost function is not callable

check_generation()¶

Check the cost of each individual in the cost function implemented by the user

new_generation()¶

Build a new generation sampled from the vector of probabilities. Updates the generation pandas dataframe

run(output=True)¶

Run method to execute the EDA algorithm

Parameters

output (bool) – True if wanted to print each iteration

Returns

best cost, best individual, history of costs along execution

Return type

float, pandas dataframe, list

truncation()¶

Selection of the best individuals of the actual generation. Updates the generation by selecting the best individuals

update_vector()¶

From the best individuals update the vector of normal distributions in order to the next generation can sample from it. Update the vector of normal distributions

EDAspy.optimization.univariate.discrete module¶

class EDAspy.optimization.univariate.discrete.UMDAd(MAX_IT, DEAD_ITER, SIZE_GEN, ALPHA, vector, cost_function, aim)¶

Bases: object

Univariate marginal Estimation of Distribution algorithm. New individuals are sampled from a vector of univariate probabilities. It is a binary optimizer, than can be used for example for feature selection.

Parameters

  • SIZE_GEN (int) – total size of the generations in the execution of the algorithm

  • MAX_IT (int) – total number of iterations in case that optimum is not yet found. If reached, the optimum found is returned

  • DEAD_ITER (int) – total number of iteration with no better solution found. If reached, the optimum found is returned

  • ALPHA (float [0-1]) – percentage of the generation tu take, in order to sample from them. The best individuals selection

  • vector (pandas dataframe with columns ['mu', 'std'] and optional ['max', 'min']) – vector of normal distributions to sample from

  • aim (string ['minimize' or 'maximize']) – ‘minimize’ or ‘maximize’. Represents the optimization aim.

  • cost_function (callable function which receives a dictionary as input and returns a numeric value) – cost function to minimize

Raises

Exception – cost function is not callable

check_generation()¶

Check the cost of each individual in the cost function implemented by the user

esc = 15¶
individuals_selection()¶

Selection of the best individuals of the actual generation and updates the generation by selecting the best individuals

new_generation()¶

Build a new generation sampled from the vector of probabilities and updates the generation pandas dataframe

run(output=True)¶

Run method to execute the EDA algorithm

Parameters

output (bool) – True if wanted to print each iteration

Returns

best cost, best individual, history of costs along execution

Return type

float, pandas dataframe, list

update_vector()¶

From the best individuals update the vector of probabilities in order to the next generation can sample from it and update the vector of probabilities
